intro: Forbicina, commonly known as the "butterfly weed," is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the genus Asclepias and is part of the milkweed family, Apocynaceae. The plant is characterized by its showy, orange and yellow flowers that attract various pollinators, including butterflies and bees. Forbicina is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, open areas such as prairies and roadsides. Its latex sap contains toxic compounds, making it unpalatable to most herbivores.
